text: Well, *that* was a remarkable meal, and I say that as someone who eats well pretty much all the time.
Was very happy to give props to Lynne for this After Ellen profile: http://icanhaz.com/aelynne
The less I want or need things, the more of those things I get. There must be a name for this paradox.
@mat was anticipating the new Madonna, but she chose to cover Timberlake's 1st album instead of his 2nd, so it sounds dated & uninspired
The whole office is bobbing their heads to MJ's home demo of "Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough". I've found my people!
I also hereby declare this the day of 1,000 trains pulling away from the station just as I show up.
I hereby declare today The Day of 1,000 Typos!
Mario Kart Wii friends, I'm at 0602 6699 7772. (I got my own code.)
"Void where prohibited." is a lot funnier if you read it as a command instead of a disclaimer.
pwned @jkottke and a bunch of people around the world on Rainbow Road. ah Mario Kart, it's good to have you back in my life.
Mario Kart Friendcode: 2492 4530 8263
I always forget how ridiculously small Rhode Island is. It's like New England Nano.
Just got offstage at roflcon -- thanks to everyone on the panel + in the audience, that was really fun!
@alicetiara absolutely killin' it at roflcon, with the call for mememakers to do something meaningful

Hey, mom, I finally made it to M.I.T.!
To talk about lolcats. :/
Something about hanging out with the "professional blogger" scene makes me talk all kinds of shit. But: publicly snarky, privately sincere!
@aa i looove you man. @mike_ftw i love you too. mmm this dribk is delicous!
nerding out on the bus with @mathowie and @pbausch
I am increasingly of the opinion that the key to success is getting someone to fund one's particular madness.
@capndesign's genius custard-ordering strategy has ensured that this will be on of my best Shake Shack meals of the day.
There's only one hit pop single with a hook about leaking a sex tape to YouTube. Naturally, this is the one that R. Kelly chooses to remix.
@sashafrerejones I was thinking that Stargate could use a good documentary about their production work. Same kinda thing. :)
How often do you get to work at a job you truly love in a city you love? I figure once or twice in a lifetime. http://icanhaz.com/6anyc
My dog's comedic timing is flawless, responding to my rambling on a phone call by flopping over with a big, dramatic sigh.
I think I'm the only dude who is strongly in favor of the big purple five on our new currency.
i make a little cameo appearance in this month's Wired: http://icanhaz.com/purple
6A NYC's sound system just started playing Prince. I feel so welcomed!
Regret that an attempt at dark humor made me seem cynical. This is why Valleywag sez I'm "publicly snarky, privately earnest." :)
I grew up in suburban/rural Pennsylvania, so I'm excited to find out today whether my people are more racist or more sexist. I think I know.
I began Earth Day with a cross-country flight. Next, I will reintroduce styrofoam burger boxes.
Today's most ridiculous Actual Mariah Carey Lyric: "I brings that levity."
"Six Apart's New York City office" is one of those phrases I have been waiting a *long* time to hear.
it's like charlie brown finally got to kick the football
Good dinner with an old friend is a great lead-in to a long night of work ahead.
Few things annoy me more than seeing a truly bad alto sax player honking away on the street.
Holy crap! From the "worst boss ever" files, my Dad tells me of an ex-boss who had A PICTURE OF HITLER in his office. No joke.
my parents have more than 50 rose bushes in the yard. "a few more and you'll need an agricultural permit -- that's farming, not gardening!"
My parents have me watching an Indian game show where 3 generations of a family dance a self-choreographed routine to a pop song. Uh, wow.
We handed an 8gb Zune to a 6-month old baby. So far, she thinks the side is tasty.
twitter seems to show that everyone is having a really good saturday so far. kickass.
Reading TechCrunch is reminding me of Six Apart's first strategic acquisition, five+ years ago. http://icanhaz.com/faxmachine
Crashing at Ben and Mena's place, just like old times. Except we're all old now.
Absolutely overwhelmed by the kindness and generosity of my coworkers. <3 6A
astounded that the Movable Type-powered iVillage blogs got a shout-out in tonight's episode of 30 Rock
@grahamblank thanks for the heroism!
Elapsed time to unlocking: about 8 minutes. :) 6A ftw.
Any 6A people still in or near the office? I'm locked out! :)
Today's interviews for my creative environments series: Pierre Omidyar, Jeff Bezos and Ray Ozzie on workspaces. http://icanhaz.com/workspace
Loving @garyvee talking to the assembled troops at Six Apart world headquarters.
Creative Environments: I interviewed Ray Ozzie for my blog, talking about his soundtrack for making Lotus Notes. http://icanhaz.com/rozzie
Really loving how easy it is to update everything with Blog It: http://www.typepad.com/features/blogit.html
This fuzzy-headed version of extreme jet lag is what I imagine being drunk must feel like. Not entirely unpleasant, but slow and stupid.
Beautiful, sunny day in SF follows similarly unlikely great weather I've seen in London, Paris and NYC in the past week. I bring Spring!
If I weren't in a hurry, I'd be marvelling at finding the only deliberate, overly-cautious cabdriver in NYC. Right now, it's super annoying.
Up to an early start, surprisingly. The city is very charming when it's still quiet.
One of the hardest things to explain is that some people who look like they're barely working are getting lots done, and vice versa.
awesome thing: dragging people from the "friends" group to the "coworkers" group in my IM client. (although, you know, we're still friends.)
Very heartened to hear the neighborhood kids explaining the Flying Spaghetti Monster to each other. High schoolers give me so much hope.
The Creative Environment: My interviews about innovation, with answers from tech leaders -- and from you too? http://icanhaz.com/createnv
hmm, persistent storage + IPs -- Amazon's EC2 is rockin' these days. http://icanhaz.com/ec2storage
Snoop Dogg covers The Time -- target demographic: me.
WTF Shawn Fanning in a Volkswagen ad? Next up: Bram Cohen selling you breakfast cereal. I found RaisinBran.torrent on Pirate Bay!
The best thing about being in Central Park at 9am is all the off-leash dogs having the most fun they've had all week.
Ssam bar playing ODB's Shimmy Shimmy Ya while serving oysters == delicious. "yeah baby i like it raaaaaw..."
Beautiful weather in Paris yesterday and NYC today confirms: Spring is here, people! Start birds-and-beesing!
I've never done that thing where I tweet so much that I take over your whole Recent page. So tempting! Only 15 or so to go...
I see a @heather doppleganger ahead and am sorely tempted to take an under-90-second video of her just to show the web who's boss.
I think Prince wrote "Strange Relationship" just to be the soundtrack for me going through U.S. customs and immigration. Google the lyrics.
A grown man next to me is advocating The Secret (the book) to a first-time U.S. visitor. Dude, you're making us all look bad. You chump.
Lining up eagerly to spend an extra 10 minutes on a plane we're about to endure for 8+ hours seems like, well, terminal stupidity.
On the other hand, a walk in the sun across the Tower Bridge and cup of tea by the Thames is like being in a very *good* romantic comedy.
circling the arc de triomphe on the back of a scooter at rush hour feels something like being in the 2nd act of a bad romantic comedy.
Astoundingly, I have found myself in Espoo.
one great thing about being at wit's end is finding out how many smart, talented, competent people have got my back. Woooo!
totally at wit's end with travel woes in CDG
Oh, Clear card, why do I love you? Because you bring a measure of dignity to the constant insult that is travel.
Dan Farber interviews Dan Bricklin. *This* is what I want to see from tech journalism. http://icanhaz.com/bricklin
Delighting myself by creating a nearly album-length "Beyonce and Jay-Z" playlist. That's how I like it.
At certain times and places, all of Manhattan is populated by European tourists enjoying the weak dollar. It's like a free trip to the EU.
One of the great ways the East Village feels like a small town is the "back in 5 minutes" sign in the bakery window. At 10pm on a Saturday.
@jbrotherlove agreed, the VF cover says "here I am" and the album cover is more "here's janice dickerson!"
Just saw Ziggy Sobotka; wish he had a duck with him.
Holy cow -- sunny, Saturday and in the sixties. I hereby declare it Spring!
Incredibly stuffed full of good food after a fun dinner with good friends. Things in my life are going according to plan.
first @dollarshort returns, now @textism is blogging again? there may still be hope for this web yet. 2001 web 4eva.
nice story about the making of the Paris Metro's signature font: http://tinyurl.com/6fukyo
Been meaning to write this one for a while: http://icanhaz.com/atomwins AtomPub is now used by both Google and MS for their cloud databases.
There is no problem so complex that it can't be exacerbated by hitting the "Send" button.
happy birthday, @djacobs!
(don't tell @davidhornik that was supposed to be a direct message)
@aa you'd be amazed. and they card me even though unlike hornik i can grow facial hair.
every David I have talked to today needs a haircut.
so far today i heard Mariah singing about YouTube & a reggaeton song with MySpace in the chorus, now awaiting hipster Facebook song (no emo)
Today I secretly made a phone call using a bluedouche headset, but nobody saw me do it so I think I cannot legally be prosecuted for it.
@dollarshort i think yay, but i'm a sucker for that founding fathers/brothers type of stuff
inordinately pleased with a 27min 5K today
Yet more auto-tune genius: http://tinyurl.com/2j4frs
An amusing tension watching shushing, reverent academics annoyed by loud Indians, but afraid to complain for fear of cultural insensitivity.
En route to this season's premiere Jhumpa Lahiri fanboy gathering.
My favorite blog these days, by far: http://90srbjunkie.blogspot.com/ it speaks to the very heart of me.
Just renewed IsHavingAMassage.com, if only to remind me of simpler, less fraught times. When unfunny was ok and single-serving domains rare.
@TechCrunch agreed, not very constructive. In exchange, I offer a very positive site that you should cover: http://plusoneme.com/ I dig it.
@TechCrunch you of all people appreciate a good ill-tempered rant, no? :) point me at the great AF jokes then!
